Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel Grand Palace What a fantastic hotel! Clean, comfortable, modern very helpful staff and great restaurants. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel and will definately be staying there when Im next in Tokyo. Although it is not located right in the centre of Tokyo it is 2 minutes walk to nearest subway station and there are always plenty of taxis waiting. We found the staff incredibly friendly and helpful, nothing was ever too much trouble. There is a fantastic Japanese Tepanyaki restaurant on the 23rd floor which is a must! It offers amazing views over Tokyo! The breakfast is good, there are a few shops in the lLobby as well including a massage service a barber and a gift store. A great place to stay in Tokyo!
Reviews.Author: EloiseTBrisbane

Reviews.Content: Good hotel in excellent location. Contrary to previous review, I find this hotel quite good. I had no problem speaking to hotel staff in English and breakfast is nice. The best thing about this hotel is its location, 2-minute walk to Kudanshita Metro station and 10-minute walk to Iidibashi JR station. Although it is in a business area, there are plenty of places to go out for dinner.
Reviews.Author: Chichay57

Reviews.Content: Average hotel Spent a few days here on a group tour. Would agree with other reviews - the hotel is a little dated and needs upgrading. However, breakfast was adequate and the location was not that bad. There is a metro stop very close and very easy to follow. there are probably better hotels/locations in the city but at the same time it was not as bad as soon of the other reviews say.
Reviews.Author: HT1

Reviews.Content: it is ok, but not great       room 1716
Reviews.Author: bembridge

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed My Stay at Hotel Grand Palace Stayed at this hotel 4D/3N with a big group for both business and pleasure. Lobby was really huge although seems quite worn off. Hotel was clean from the lobby, rooms and dining areas. Location was near subway stations although I would advise getting personalized tour packages to be able to offset any unfamiliarity with the place and the language barrier that often presents itself with. Lots of convenient stores , fastfood outlets and vending machines just outside the hotel. Breakfast buffet was decent though the western cuisine choices doesn't seem to impress. I like the bread selection and what seemed like cheese made to look like candies. Rooms are quite small but well lighted and functional. Would agree with other previous reviews that the room temperature can't be controlled. Room amenities impress me from the unique room slippers, toiletries , bathrobes etc. Toilet utilizes a different technology and shower was really good. What made my stay really comfortable was that majority of the staff speak good English . That was indeed a relief for someone who doesn't understand Japanese.
Reviews.Author: doctorfoxtrot

Reviews.Content: Good hotel in Tokyo Stayed at this hotel during a vacation in Tokyo. The Grand Palace Hotel is not in a prime location although it is conveniently located around 5 minutes walk from at least two subway stations. Depending on whether you walk left or right from the hotel entrance, you will end up in either the Kudanshita or Iidabashi station.The hotel has a grand and spacious lobby which is reminiscent of the 1970's. The rooms also appear to be a bit old though these are clean and well-maintained. It has the standard amenities which you can expect to find in most hotels (toiletries, bath robe, etc). The only problem with the room is the centralized airconditioning. As we stayed there during spring time, we didn't have the option of having cool air. They had the heater activated and it was a bit warm. The staff are friendly and polite. They know how to speak English and guided us with the nearby areas. We were recommended to visit a nearby area where people were viewing the cherry blossoms as well as a shrine also nearby. We visited the latter without knowing what it was. It was only later when we learned that it was the controversial Yasukuni Shrine. We had a breakfast buffet in the hotel which consisted of a sumptuous spread. Both the variety and quality were very good.Overall, I would definitely stay in this hotel again when I visit Tokyo in the future.
Reviews.Author: ACChua

Reviews.Content: Very Good Tourist-Class Hotel The Grand Palace is an excellent tourist-class hotel, with an above-average location for travellers and comfortable, clean rooms. A subway stop is just down the street and there are a variety of restaurants and grocery stores (including Western-style good offerings) just around the hotel, which make this a good choice for travellers. The top-floor bar offers some nice nighttime views, but be forewarned that it comes at a cost: there is a per-person cover charge and drinks are not cheap. I would highly recommend this hotel for travellers to Tokyo.
Reviews.Author: bttravellerToronto

Reviews.Content: excellent hotel, great location This is a very nice hotel, we got in very early but they got us into our rooms by 7am. lobby was huge, restaurant was good, toilets were fantastic and clean and hi tec. rooms were large and spacious. clean and well decorated. toilets were again well stocks with everything. the location is just behind the imperial war memorial close to the palace gardens. served by 2 under ground lines and a main line within 5 mins walk. some local restaurants but because of its location, it takes no time to get anywhere- 10 mis to asakusa, 10 mins to shinjiku.. etc. would stay there again. great value too, staff were excellent.
Reviews.Author: Raz1260

Reviews.Content: In the Middle of Tokyo Great hotel with a great location. In the middle of the city and very close to the Metro line. Beds are a bit hard for American standards. Breakfast and dinner buffet is good offering Japanese and American style dining with a view of their waterfall wall. Concierge could speak better English, but an informed traveler can get around without him. Overall great place to stay a few days in Tokyo before moving on to Kyoto.
Reviews.Author: Tiggerlover

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel We spent two nights at this hotel in early January, 2007.Service: Excellent. Staff speaks good enough English.Overall Hotel Atmosphere: WonderfulRoom and Bathrooms: No complaints at allHotel Location: Not in the centre of the touristy part of town but we did not mind. It is 2 subway stations to Ginza and other shopping districts.This was our first trip to Japan. We were mesmerized by their culture and courtesy. What a marvelous inspiration they had on me.We had heard how unaffordable Tokyo is and were very pleasantly surprised by how affordable the hotel was and the wonderful size of our room. No complaints at all.We have traveled quite a bit in Europe and are used to much smaller rooms at much higher prices. We made resevervations at Hotels.com about one week prior to our trip.Best way to arrive from Narita Airport is by the Airport Limosuine (spelling?:) Bus. Costs US $ 25/person. And they drop you right at the entrance and very pleasantly help with all your luggage. And they frown upon tipping. What a marvelous and hard-working culture.Not much of sight seeing around the hotel. It is in more of a business district. The Imperial Palace Gardens are about 15-20 minutes walk from the hotel. Do not feel too bad if you do not get to see them. But if time permits it is a nice walk and visit.There is a 7-11 and a few convenient stores near the hotel, close to the subway station entrance.We would highly recomemnd this hotel for its price, service and overall atmosphere.The hotel can assist you with various tourist tours - Mt Fuji, etc.Please feel free to contact me should you have any questions.
Reviews.Author: RoxySteele

Reviews.Content: Hotel in a beautiful time warp.
Reviews.Author: cleeksock

Reviews.Content: Fair hotel, but nothing great. Stayed at the Grand Palace for three nights on a recent trip to Tokyo. The room was small and smelled a bit funny. But the biggest problem was that they had no air conditioning in the room, since, as they kindly explained, the entire building could only be in 'heat mode' or 'cool mode'. It was in heat mode, and even with the heat turned off the room was stuffy and hot. The bathroom was exceedingly tiny and the shower head was way too low for anybody over about 5 feet.  The staff was curtious and helpful though, and the restaurants were ok, if overpriced. They do offer free internet access, which is a definite plus since most other places charge ~$15/day.  I may have been a bit harsh on the hotel, as I had just come from staying at the Four Seasons Marunouchi which was incomparably nice, but also four times the price. If you're looking for a nothing special hotel for not a bad price, the Grand Palace will certainly work.
Reviews.Author: jdubois

Reviews.Content: A very grand palace...hotel Spacious rooms, great location, very clean hotel. The Grand Palace has very helpful concierge however, when you need help, make sure they know that you're a guest of the hotel. We were trying to ask for instructions on how to ride the shinkansen and we weren't treated very well until we mentioned that we were staying at the hotel. It's about a block away from the nearest train station and about 2-3 blocks away from the nearest JR station. Breakfast buffet was included and it was exceptional. It was a combination of Western and Japanese food - great selection. To have a cheaper meal, we bought packed sushi and rice toppings from the convenience store just across the street - great Japanese food at very affordable prices.The hotel was just a few blocks away from the Tokyo Imperial Palace. Actually, it's a little out of the way but with the trains, it's really easy to get around once you get the hang of it. Just follow the colors (orange for Ginza, etc.) and know where you're going and you'll get back to the hotel safely.People in Japan are very courteous and kind but during rush hour, they're beasts! This is mostly displayed in the train stations - they push and shove and go in front of you rudely. Stay away from major stations during rush hour.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: comfort in great location A comfortable clean hotel close to the Imperial Palace and two subway stations. Travelling with my daughter from North America, it was great to have the Aiport Limo bus stop at the hotel door step. We were greeted by excellent staff with very good English. In fact all our dealings with hotel staff were pleasant and accommodating. While the hotel is not in the liveliest of areas in Tokyo, it has good reasonably-priced noodle bars and restaurants close by. I would return to this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Our Home In Tokyo I haven't done much traveling outside the US, but my wife has relatives in Japan, and so we visit there occasionally. This hotel's manager knows my wife's aunt, so perhaps we get some amount of special treatment, but even so, I believe, as with most things Japanese, the average American would be pleased with a visit. The hotel (when we last visited in 2001) was not most modern and up-to-date, but was comfortable. Our only problem is that whenever we've stayed we are given two beds and not one, but I also have to wonder whether that's because they know we're westerners. I always get the deal that includes the hotel's breakfast along with the room -- at the buffet (viking) you can eat healthy (yogurt, fruit, cereals) or have eggs, bacon, green beans (!), french fries, and the like. Or you can have an authentic Japanese breakfast (fish, rice, etc.) at the Japanese restaurant. The hotel staff all speak understandable English (as does practically everyone in Tokyo) and is exceedingly happy to help. There's an express bus (for a fee) directly from and to Narita. The hotel is a block from one subway station and three blocks from another, near the Imperial Palace and gardens and a nice walk (or run) along the Tokyo River. You're also not far from the Tokyo Dome, in case the Yomiuri Giants are in town. And, if you hunger for things western, there's a McDonald's around the corner, two Starbucks nearby, etc., etc. And, oh yes, you get the fancy electronic toilet seats. If you stay across the Imperial Gardens the hotels will be fancier and more expensive, but if you're sightseeing, you don't need to worry about what's in your hotel room, anyway.By the way, we've always managed to log into America Online from the hotel, so we can even check our email.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: 銈广偪銉冦儠銇蹇溿亴绱犳櫞銈夈仐銇嬨仯銇熴€?#x201d;   showReview(23388373, 'full');
